title: Tailwind CSS Configuration Reference
description: This document provides a technical reference for the Tailwind CSS configuration, outlining the settings and options available.
author: Documentation Team

blocks.content: This configuration file does not define any classes or methods but exports a single configuration object for Tailwind CSS.
- **darkMode**: Enables dark mode based on the presence of a specific class.

content
- Specifies the paths to all files that Tailwind should scan for class names.
- Includes JavaScript, TypeScript, JSX, TSX, and MDX files in the specified directories.
The theme property contains theme-related configurations. The extend property allows for the addition of custom values without overriding the default theme.
- Node.js: Ensure that Node.js is installed in your environment to use Tailwind CSS.
- Tailwind CSS: This configuration requires the Tailwind CSS library to be installed.
This configuration does not define any custom exception classes. Errors related to configuration will typically be handled by the Tailwind CSS library.
- Configuration retrieval failure may occur if the configuration object is malformed.
Ensure that the configuration adheres to the expected structure to avoid runtime errors.
